title: website background color
content: I need to change my background color in firefox. Suggestions I find dont work. Options / Customize I cant find. Can you suggest some details?
creator: funorama

title: Megasync não entra
content: Começando por hoje, não consegui fazer download de arquivos de sites usando o megasync. No site Mega pede pra baixar o gerenciador de downloads, mas ele já está no pc. Mesmo baixando ele continua não reconhecendo o app. No entanto o problema não é da máquina, pois no Google Chrome e no Edge, funciona normalmente. Podem ajudar?
creator: nricardo.sousa

title: a web page access
content: I can access the login page of the online course I am taking but cannot enter the course. It could be a firewall but I have no idea and neither does my husband. It started when he got a new lap top and linked/synced to our desktop.
creator: cindyscricket

title: Mozilla Firefox account -- lost access to primary email and requires authentication to switch to my registered secondary address
content:
Hello,

I have lost access to the primary email on my account. I will never be able to get it back, it was a work email address from a previous employer.

I had already registered a secondary email address but it won't let me switch it to primary without confirmation to the current primary address. Is there a way around this issue, or am I stuck with my account set permanently to a dead inbox?
creator: darrell.bunger

title: MSEdge, Why Is it Allowed to Get My Mozilla PW's fm FireFox ?
content:
Ok. So i have never ever used MS Edge for logging into FireFox and Mozilla accounts. But low and behold, MSEdge now has these Login and PW's for these accounts.

I had brought up this observation, in the recent past, regarding how MSEdge aggregated all my logins and pw's from FireFox. And the response was for me to use a Master Password.

But this isnt the solution or the issue at hand.

The concern is why does Edge believe it is entitled to aggregate my FireFox PW's? And when does it do so? And how does it tap into the encrypted FF files? Yet, Edge has not aggregated the bookmarks in FF.

Something is not right nor ethical.

Interestingly, perhaps FireFox users that lose their logins and passwords in FireFox browser can tap into MSEdge to restore them? Seems like a reasonable solution.
creator: databaseben
